website_summaries.verdict: A large trap that has the advantage of folding flat when not in use for easier storage.
pros: Good sensitivity on the release mechanism
Less expensive than others of the same size
Comes with video link to explain set up
cons: Animals can sometimes get in and out of this trap without setting off the trigger for the door

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for feral cats
customer_reviews.text: I have feral cats living in the storm water detention pond next to my home. I needed a reasonable priced and easy to use trap to catch the cats to have them spayed/neutered and returned home. This was easy to put together following the diagrams and instructions. I love that it collapses so it doesn't take much room to store. It is well built and strong enough to last for years!
customer_reviews.author: pryncessr

customer_reviews.title: This is a great trap, on the first day of delivery
customer_reviews.text: This is a great trap, on the first day of delivery, after I assembled it and set it out with bait, it caught a cat in less than forty minutes, from purchase to date, I have caught a total of seven alley cats, mostly male cats that have been pissing on my patio and on my front door which caused paint damage, the last cat I caught was a pretty fat cat, unusual for a homeless cat, it tried hard to free itself from the cage, but could not, I’m convinced that the cage is well built after seeing that cat struggling to set itself free, I gave this trap a five star rating it was well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Raamah Kush

customer_reviews.title: Did the job!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Trapped the very skittish cat in a couple of hours. I did not look at the paper instructions that came with it; I went straight to the YouTube video other reviews mentioned and I was able to assemble it quickly. It arrived on time and was a decent price compared to some other cage options. Great purchase, very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: L.L.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well made trap with sensitive trip plate
customer_reviews.text: Before we purchased this trap, we had tried 2 other humane traps to catch a stray cat we had been feeding. She is very small and the trip plates on the other traps were not sensitive enough, but this trap has a very sensitive trigger and we caught her within 30 minutes of putting the trap out. The trap is fairly spacious, as far as traps go, and seems to be made of very sturdy metal. Also, the trap came with several pages of information from Ranger Dave's (the manufacturer) that detailed how to trap and release various kinds of wildlife, which would be very helpful if you were using the trap for a raccoon, opossum, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Zaballa

customer_reviews.title: This trap is good for larger animals or maybe a fat cat but ...
customer_reviews.text: I was trying to catch some stray cats in the neighborhood but it did not work. The cats would eat the bait and the trap would not release because the back end is too short. The cats just leaned over without stepping on the trigger. Maybe if the back end of the trap was longer the cats would have no choice but to step on the trigger in order to get to the bait. This trap is good for larger animals or maybe a fat cat but it did not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Frances Serna

customer_reviews.title: Humane not
customer_reviews.text: My semi-feral beloved cat was trapped for five yowling, heart pounding minutes (instead of the intended target raccoon.) He emerged with two bloody front paws, head lacerations and the skin of his nose looked like someone took a cheese grater to it. For three days it hurt him to walk and a week to heal his nose. He'll have permanent scars both externally and internally. Humane my butt. I shudder to imagine what could happen if a poor animal got into this torture device and no one was nearby at the time to release it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Searles

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly and instructions
customer_reviews.text: The collapsible animal cage is well worth your money. Easy assembly and instructions. My box came damaged and one end appeared to be retaped. The long rod looked like it had been assembled & forced into place; However the dealer offered to replace the cage & I could keep then other with damaged rod. My nearby Pet & Feed store repaired the rod without cost & my cage was better than his heavy cages and lot less expensive. We know this will work now & will send photos of the ferrel kittens in the cage soon.
customer_reviews.author: L. C. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: TNRing is amazing! She is now spayed thanks to the trap
customer_reviews.text: I used this to catch the feral female cat that started hanging out on my property. I let her eat out of it for about a week, before I sat the trap. TNRing is amazing! She is now spayed thanks to the trap, I will feed her for the rest of her life, and there will be no more feral kittens born and eventually taking over my property!
customer_reviews.author: SamGo

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The trap worked very well. We set it in the morning and had an animal in it by the end of the day. It is easy to use, folds down and takes very small space to store. We are very happy with the purchase. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy, Effective Trap
customer_reviews.text: Trap arrived quickly with minimal packaging. Set up was simple with a little thinking and looking at included instructions. Just required clicking a few wires into place and it was ready to go. Caught a possum the first night and then the problem groundhog the next day. He was at least 12lbs! and fit in the trap easily. Releasing the animals was also easy, they were both happy to escape! Both animals had scraped up their noses and mouths some trying to get out but still seemed okay. Trap was completely fine, no bending evident. Hated having to spend so much to get critters out of garden, but it works!
customer_reviews.author: dg

customer_reviews.title: Pesky Rabbits
customer_reviews.text: This trap did the trick for the rabbit(s) that were eating all my landscape plants, eating from the bottom up. They were ruining my small patch of grass as well and nothing I'd used, (sprays, smelly powders) were working. I watched the YouTube video they suggest and set up was quickly accomplished. Used bib lettuce and apple cores and caught a rabbit the first night. Now that I have blocked off all the entry ways I can think of, I hope this takes care of my rabbit problem.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie Kay

customer_reviews.title: Trap
customer_reviews.text: This trap works perfectly... Had a bunch of stray cats to catch and get fixed for no more babies........
customer_reviews.author: Cloud Dancer2

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: This product was very easy to assemble, and set up. I bought it for relocation of stray cats, and in the first 3 days, I relocated 3 strays. The cage is a little on the flimsy side, but it definitely is sturdy enough for trapping cats. Overall, I am very satisfied with this trap, and would highly recommend it for anyone else looking to humanely relocate stray cats.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good For Small Critters.
customer_reviews.text: The cat in the picture is a full sized feral cat. It broke out of the cage like it was made of paper. Under 4 pound critters should not be a problem. The video instructions are weak. You can figure out the assembly on your own. Just take some time. A raccoon would rip this trap apart easily.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Mann

customer_reviews.title: Bad Trap
customer_reviews.text: This trap was tricky to assemble the final rod to spring the trap. I followed the directions provided as to how to trap a feral cat. The cat went in, set off the trapping door, but managed to escape from the trap. When I returned to the trap, the interior newspaper was all ripped up, the bait was half under the interior plate. No cat. I had placed the back door bar as shown, but I was able to pull a corner of the back door away to create a space through which, I guess, the cat must have struggled to escape. This trap was useless.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M. Ormond

customer_reviews.title: A very successful live trap. Easy to use & no problems setting up.
customer_reviews.text: This trap was Easy to set up and caught the 2 rabbits that were eating my shrubs. Success the 1st and second nights I used it. Even though it was -10 & tons of snow I baited with 2-frozen half pieces corn on the cob, carrots and 1/2 an apple. I placed it on my deck next to the shrubs they were eating at night. After being caught They were then relocated to a forest about 5 miles from me.
customer_reviews.author: Roxi R

customer_reviews.title: Caught 3 cats so far
customer_reviews.text: Its a pretty nice trap, very similar to a foldable crate for transporting pets. I've caught 3 cats so far so I feel like its paid for itself.
customer_reviews.author: C.Strawn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Trap
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I’ve caught everything around my house except the slick tom cat I purchased it for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: I like the trap but I had to make a small modification to trap the smaller rabbits. I bent the rod that was attached to the trip plate. A small modification and the rabbits are gone. It would be great if the manufacturer would make this modification on all their future traps.
customer_reviews.author: joef

customer_reviews.title: Worked flawlessly! Caught predator who was killing my chickens
customer_reviews.text: Worked flawlessly! We finally got the predator that had killed 4 of my chickens. 2 layers and 2 meat birds. As I suspected it was a bobcat. Make sure to check with your local fish & wildlife department for regulations, and assistance.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal J

customer_reviews.title: It was good for me because it was not to heavy with ...
customer_reviews.text: 9 lb. Kitty went in and out 5 times drinking milk untilll maybe a back foot triggered it ? I had. A problem with it setting off to soon then not at all. I would not depend on it for a raccoon or strong animal. It was good for me because it was not to heavy with the cat in it like the old industrial cage. Reasonable price for my problem!
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis A. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't hold cat.
customer_reviews.text: The trap failed twice to trip the trap door, third time worked. However, even with the metal bar in place (as per video), cat was able to escape through the back door, injuring itself. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Ranger Daves animal trap
customer_reviews.text: Wish the instructions were better. Haven't caught anything yet, but so far I don't think any of my fancy goldfish have disappeared. I had to go online to figure out how to put it together and set it. Also had to enlist a neighbor to help, but it is set and I'm hopeful to get rid of at least one raccoon.
customer_reviews.author: Lorena Barrow

customer_reviews.title: Got a trap from brother in law that he has had for 25 years and still working great.
customer_reviews.text: worked well at first. After 5 catches the tabs attached to the pad to close trap were bent by animal and now doesn"t work. Dissapointed. Got a trap from brother in law that he has had for 25 years and still working great.
customer_reviews.author: Terry B.

customer_reviews.title: Appears to be a good trap
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a very nice trap. I haven't been able to use it yet, but it seems sturdy once assembled, and the trip plate seems to be sensitive enough to do the job. The only reason for four instead of five stars is that it's not quite as easy to assemble as the instructions indicate (could be from shifting of rods/rings during shipping). You may need to tighten some of the metal rings that hold it together.
customer_reviews.author: Susan P

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me!
customer_reviews.text: This product did the job. Had a feral kitten I wanted to trap. After 3 days and 2 other catches(opossum, feral cat), I got the little guy. Now he has been vetted and is living in style with me.
customer_reviews.author: lablady

customer_reviews.title: Live trap
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, and fairly easy to assemble. Successful in trapping unwanted animals. Ease of release. Price was better than most similar traps
customer_reviews.author: Richard D. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Trap works great, got my target animal the first night
customer_reviews.text: Amazon prime delivered my trap Sunday afternoon, trap assembly took 5 minutes, baited and set the trap and Monday morning I caught my targeted animal.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. I have two now and like this one the best. Had a feral cat problem but this made catching her easy. I took her into our local scraps, they spayed her and brought her back. All ends well thanks to THIS trap. Yes, I'd buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer. Beverly Lentz

customer_reviews.title: Caught the raccoon in one hour!
customer_reviews.text: The trap works great! We had a pesky raccoon eating all our bird food and getting too close to our chickens for several months. Within an hour of setting it up and putting it on our back deck, the raccoon was trapped inside. We used the suggested marshmallow idea. It was easy to transport and release. The raccoon was safe the entire time. Very humane way of removing a pest.
customer_reviews.author: J. DeGraff

customer_reviews.title: Ranger Products Large Collapsible Trap arrived-- MISSING IMPORTANT PIECES!
customer_reviews.text: Help--- the trap was missing the metal clips that holds the closable trap door. It was NOT attached. When someone makes good on this--- and it does work as promised-- I will be happy to give you a much better review. PLEASE RUSH ME 3 metal clips so I can put the trap together! ASAP! Thanks a million!
customer_reviews.author: T. D. Baddick

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The trap is very strong, and works perfectly. Setting it up was a bit difficult as one of the braces didn't fit into place easily. It just took a little extra time to fix.
customer_reviews.author: Carl E.

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this flimsy trap. I did manage to trap one feral cat. The second one busted out immediately because the door didn't latch. Now she is trap shy and I don't know when I'll ever be able to get her spayed. Hopefully before she has a litter.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Bricker

customer_reviews.title: Super east to set up
customer_reviews.text: Super east to set up, very strong and light. Caught two raccoons first night and easy to release. I recommend this to anyone trying to trap live animals and move them.
customer_reviews.author: DavidMassillonOh

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This trap was easy to set up and works great. There was one spot on it that came loose, but it was easy to fix. We are very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: S. Altman

customer_reviews.title: Great Trap
customer_reviews.text: This worked super great! Took care of the problem I was having and then passed it on to someone else in need. No animal was hurt in the use of this item. I would buy it again if I ever have the need for it again. Instructions that came with it were not great. Used instructions on UTube which were much much better.
customer_reviews.author: Norma Villafranca

customer_reviews.title: Great light trap, easy to assemble and it works.
customer_reviews.text: The trap worked well, was easy to assemble, even for an older lady. Great product, Timely delivery, Amazon came through again on an item I really needed.
customer_reviews.author: Debby Christenseen

customer_reviews.title: company did the right thing
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble with the set up - wasn't able to trap the animal but the company gave me a full refund which was great!!
customer_reviews.author: mj

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm! We purchased the cage to help a neighbor that couldn’t round up their outdoor cat before moving. We were able to catch the cat within a few days and return him to his owner. We accidentally trapped a different cat initially, so it worked great both times!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work well
customer_reviews.text: Broke first time we tried it. Not a strong enough construction for a raccoon.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Pruitt Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, helped me catch my cat after he got out and also the neighborhood stray which I then took to the SPCA
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey’s Review

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cat trap
customer_reviews.text: Fast, excellent service; trap is exactly as described, & will be used in pet rescue
customer_reviews.author: sheryl

customer_reviews.title: Great strong and simple to use
customer_reviews.text: Got it for stray cats over populating the neighborhood hasn't let me down yet some times 2 in a hr
customer_reviews.author: Bluejay

customer_reviews.title: Did the trick!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together.. works great caught a stray in the first hour.. kept peeing on our cars and front door. Realeased at a local park and was able to transport and open the cage without harming the stray or myself.. used tuna for bait
customer_reviews.author: Dad

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: My first review was not a happy one . But now that things have been taken care of , I am happy with the outcome. I was sent a new trap and I am happy with this one . I want to thank Dave for all he does to make sure his customers are happy and satisfied with his product. . This one also came with a guide to finish assembling it .
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Chapel

customer_reviews.title: Not well constructed.
customer_reviews.text: The larger size was needed. The first evening the raccoon was trapped, had dinner and left by easily squeezing through the back by pushing the other end open easily. The back opened enough to allow the raccoon to walk out the other end. The way the "closed" end needs significant adjustments to allow trapping to be effective.
customer_reviews.author: Karen & Art

customer_reviews.title: Relocated what nightmares are made of
customer_reviews.text: Worked well caught a total of 6 opossum They were killing my chickens
customer_reviews.author: Happyasaclam

customer_reviews.title: No assembly instructions in the box!
customer_reviews.text: There were no instructions at all in the box. I still haven’t fully assembled it, but will try to find the right video on You Tube. Also, the trap is a lot heavier than other ones I’ve used.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: catch and release ... success!
customer_reviews.text: Nice size, weight and construction. I am glad I purchased this cage. It is easy to set-up and transport.
customer_reviews.author: Linda RDH

customer_reviews.title: Not a trap for raccoons
customer_reviews.text: This trap is worthless for the smart raccoons. Caught two raccoons in the trap, and both escaped the trap through the entrance trap door. The trap door does not have a security feature that wiil lock the door and keep a raccoon from escaping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crap. Trap was sprung 3 times and no raccoon.
customer_reviews.text: Crap. Trap was sprung 3 times and no raccoon. The metal rod that connects to trap level slips off causing the trap door to not close. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: South Florida home investors

customer_reviews.title: Questionable quality
customer_reviews.text: We ordered two traps, one worked great and the other was a total fail. It must've been bent or had some sort of fault from the factory because all the mechanisms rubbed together which caused it to get stuck. Several racoons went in and out of the trap. Bought a product from Havahart instead and worked much better.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Light weight trap
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and rusting after 2 weeks. A raccoon destroyed the trap getting out.
customer_reviews.author: Jake304

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Caught my critters the same night. It wasn't hard to set up. I'm not sure what the other reviews were about with it not working, but mine worked right out of the box. Easy setup and easy instructions for me. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Happy

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Well built live trap. I had a little trouble figuring out how to assemble it, but they provide a video on their website that makes it all make sense. I haven't trapped any raccoons yet, but it's not the trap's fault. They're just too smart for me!
customer_reviews.author: Warneke

customer_reviews.title: Well Built, Simple, Humane
customer_reviews.text: Well built and simple to set up. Can be collapsed for ease of storage. The trigger takes just a light touch so good for small to medium sized critters. Would hold a good sized racoon easily. Long enough to prevent catching all but the longest tails.
customer_reviews.author: Rik Tweed

customer_reviews.title: very easy. to get up
customer_reviews.text: very easy.to get up. very little pressure is required on the trip plate before the door closes. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl L Barela

customer_reviews.title: nice cage
customer_reviews.text: I have a ground hog problem but he will not be a problem much longer
customer_reviews.author: Rev.Howard

customer_reviews.title: Nice trap but not as sturdy as desired and trap ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice trap but not as sturdy as desired and trap clamp difficult to hold in place. At times releases before the target enters.
customer_reviews.author: Loving My Angels

customer_reviews.title: Good, sturdy cage~
customer_reviews.text: Good, sturdy cage. I haven't attempted to collapse it back yet..hopefully fairly simple as setting up.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality. Raccoon broke free.
customer_reviews.text: I caught a raccoon on first night I set the trap, but the raccoon managed to escape the trap by bending the metal rod that holds the back gate in place. He pulled it to him and bent it just enough to enable him to open the gate and get out. Now it just ignores the trap and goes straight for the trash. Recommend a stronger, more sturdy trap.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Bearden

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: It takes a little work to line up the pieces just right but it's a fine value. I just used it to evict an uninvited guest from my attic. The rod that connects the door to the pad seems like it could use some redesign but it does break free the way it should in action. Not bad at all!
customer_reviews.author: nunya business

customer_reviews.title: Nice trap, very sensitive, not too difficult to figure out
customer_reviews.text: Very, very touchy, both as a collapsible cage and as a pressure-sensitive device. Bought this to catch our escaped indoor semi-feral Maine Coon cat. No luck yet, but here's hoping.
customer_reviews.author: Bibliotricks

customer_reviews.title: Maybe but not worth the effort.
customer_reviews.text: It might work for someone else but for me: It was difficult to put together. Tricky to set up. Also it was heavy, if I were to catch an animal in it, I wouldn't be able to lift it.
customer_reviews.author: Nan Deveroux

customer_reviews.title: caught feral cat and kittens
customer_reviews.text: Caught feral cat and her kittens. Worked for what I needed it for. Have not tried it for any other type of animal. Seems sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: terri

customer_reviews.title: Good product but no instructions
customer_reviews.text: Great product but super hard to put together! No instructions
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Johnson

customer_reviews.title: ITS USED
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to use this today to capture my missing cat that got outside while I was moving. This just came in the mail and its all beaten up where the door release is. Therefore, the door will not stay open for longer than three seconds before falling down. WHAT A WASTE OF MONEY!!!! Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Nikitina

customer_reviews.title: No instructions, not easy to figure out.
customer_reviews.text: was not easy to assemble, quality is meh, I would not recommend or buy again
customer_reviews.author: Luxor

customer_reviews.title: Bunnies relocated
customer_reviews.text: We have an abundance of cottontails in our area. Every once in a while they find a way into our yard. This is great for capturing them and relocating to their natural environment.
customer_reviews.author: Golf fan Di

customer_reviews.title: Caught the four kittens and mom. Kits are in ...
customer_reviews.text: Caught the four kittens and mom. Kits are in new homes . Mom is spayed, healed and back in the woods behind the house. Still,comes out to get food. Trap worked beautified.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: catching the critters
customer_reviews.text: the 1st thing I caught was possum ( small) and when I picked up the trap by the handles it was able to squeeze out the side by the trap door. I hope the trap workes better on the next critter.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Trap works great! Easy to setup and use!
customer_reviews.text: Love this trap! First night setting out and caught stray cat!😀 Beats my homemade trap, which worked, but not as easy as this one!
customer_reviews.author: dsrtrt

customer_reviews.title: This cage is made cheaply. I have caught 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: This cage is made cheaply. I have caught 2 groundhogs in this trap. Both times I had to repair the trip mechanism. The animals have tore it up both times. The rod for the trip lever being inside gets abuses by pissed of animals.
customer_reviews.author: M. Birkley

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble & set up. BUT, the smallish rabbit is taking the bait & not triggering the trap! What to do? Have left Dave & Co a message.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline J. Turner

customer_reviews.title: I'm satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I bought this trap to catch some cats for spay/neuter. There was a small problem with a part that was loose but it was easily fixed. Now if the cats will just cooperate.
customer_reviews.author: Ladycat

customer_reviews.title: Raccoon cage
customer_reviews.text: It was the right size to catch a raccoon. I caught one but apparently he was strong enough to break through the end and get away. Works great for opposoms.
customer_reviews.author: Judi

customer_reviews.title: It works for me
customer_reviews.text: Easy to load, easy to set, and we've helped reduce the local pest population. Now we could just get the damn cats to walk right in....
customer_reviews.author: T. L. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Arrived bent on one end but wired seemed pretty sturdy when I was straightening it back out
customer_reviews.text: Arrived bent on one end but wired seemed pretty sturdy when I was straightening it back out. Sorta a pain setting up trap mechanism but seems to work alright.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Brown

customer_reviews.title: was easy to assemble (love that it is collapsible) and is ...
customer_reviews.text: The trap arrived quickly, was easy to assemble (love that it is collapsible) and is the perfect size to move around to different locations for trapping. And...the price is great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The raccoon can get in and get the small tin ...
customer_reviews.text: The raccoon can get in and get the small tin of food and not spring the trap until going back out. The trap door will shut but the raccoon is most of the way through it. I get a few sprigs hair on the door. It needs to be longer it is too short.
customer_reviews.author: Machelle W. McCarter

customer_reviews.title: Problem gone!
customer_reviews.text: I had a very mean nasty feral cat, that was making life miserable for my outdoor cats. This trap worked great. My cats are happy again.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Gray

customer_reviews.title: relocating feral cats
customer_reviews.text: I live in a neighborhood with a big stray problem and I needed affordable humane traps. I like that they're collapsible and seem more than sturdy enough for cats.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Consider before purchasing
customer_reviews.text: Product was not sturdy enough to keep a coon trapped.
customer_reviews.author: objective

customer_reviews.title: Good investment.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality materials with quick door closure. Design allows for compact storage when not in use, should last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Cole

customer_reviews.title: Very simple to  use
customer_reviews.text: This trap was great. First time we ever used a trap, and it worked the very first time. Stray cats under our porch, so this trap worked just what we needed
customer_reviews.author: Marsha Bostic

customer_reviews.title: big problem
customer_reviews.text: door is not tight, squirrels can get in and steal the bait then squeeze out the side of the closed door. Wish I did not throw away the box.
customer_reviews.author: John G. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Had many wild cats and used the trap to catch them. Worked perfect. Easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Y

customer_reviews.title: This trap was a GOD send... Caught ...
customer_reviews.text: This trap was a GOD send...Caught my little opossum guy the first try and he was safe. Moved him to another location. This product was as described and more. Even though it is collapsible, I will be leaving it put together.
customer_reviews.author: The Riding Realtor

customer_reviews.title: My cat recently escaped for a second time. Instead ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat recently escaped for a second time. Instead of renting one from the local Humane Society I went ahead bought one. It is well worth the money in case my cat escapes again. I was lucky that I got him back.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great, works, instructions could be better (very dark photocopies), but easy to figure out, already relocated one groundhog.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian

customer_reviews.title: Good Trap, It works!!
customer_reviews.text: Received in a timely manner. It was exactly what I expected and it works. I've already caught my first Iguana. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Swaney

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction, easy set-up, secure catch.
customer_reviews.text: Easy set-up, SOLID construction. Cats will NOT escape once inside. Safe handling and rear gate animal-removal sysyem. This one's the best I've ever used.
customer_reviews.author: S. V. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: It was just a medium sized cat and needless to say I was disappointed in the results
customer_reviews.text: The trap worked as advertised caught a stray cat the first try my complaint is when animal control showed up to carry away cat it managed to squeeze out between the trap door and the metal cage. The metal on the cage around the trap door is not strong enough to keep it's shape. It was just a medium sized cat and needless to say I was disappointed in the results!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Lamont

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Door spring not very strong. Most animals caught were able to push out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Got him!
customer_reviews.text: Got him day one!! Did not think that it was that strong when I put it together but it did the job on a huge groundhog. He is now happily living on a local golf course!
customer_reviews.author: James Lillis

customer_reviews.title: I've already caught two possums!
customer_reviews.text: Good cage for the money. The bar holding the pressure plate can be a little tricky to set, but it's very handy to be able to open the back and set bait without reaching back through the cage.
customer_reviews.author: DA, Esq.

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: So far I have caught 8 possums and 4 raccoons. I'd say it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Lefevere

customer_reviews.title: Ranger collapsible trap
customer_reviews.text: Broke the very first time we caught a raccoon ! Very disappointed ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple and solid product
customer_reviews.text: Simple, yet well thought out product. Instructions were not that great, but the Utube video cleared everything up. Great paperwork on capturing critters that came along with it.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy L.

customer_reviews.title: Great trap for adolescent cats
customer_reviews.text: Had a colony of cats living behind our new home. I bought this trap and in 3 days I had caught all 4 cats. This is very easy to set up once you understand how the mechanism works. We covered it with a towel on our patio and put and small aluminum foil bowl of tuna down then dribbled the tuna water around the area - worked so fast we caught the first one in 2 hours!
customer_reviews.author: KyNa98

product_meta.title: Large Collapsible Humane Live Animal Trap Perfect for Raccoons, Stray Cats, Gopher, Opossum, Rabbits
product_meta.description:
Includes our trapping guide with instructions on the best baits to use to trap whatever animal you are looking to target. Also now all traps include printed instructions on how to take your trap from the collapsed to upright position as well as our online video showing and explaining the process step-by-step.

The dimensions of the opening of the large trap is 11.25 inches x 12.5 inches easily big enough to capture most large critters. 

It collapses down to only 1.75 inches to allow for each storage in your garage, attic, shed or barn.

Ranger Dave's live animal traps are made with the highest focus on quality construction. Our goal is to make traps that you can use for many years to come. 

This trap is our large varmint trap which works great for catching a large number of nuisance animals, everything from raccoons to stray cats, badgers and much more.

The humane trap design ensures that the animal will not be injured upon capture making for a safe release elsewhere to continue it's life away from your property.

Prime members get it in only 2 days with FREE SHIPPING click ADD TO CART now to get your trap sent out right away! 

Please Note: Does not come with a banana, it's just to show the size of the trap.
feature_bullets: HIGH QUALITY METAL: All our traps are made of high quality rust-resistant steel mesh and supports to ensure it holds up for a long time in all weather conditions.
WORKS GREAT FOR MULTIPLE ANIMAL TYPES: The large size works great for raccoon's, opossums, stray cats, groundhogs, and other large size varmints.

QUICK SHUT HAIR TRIGGER DOOR: Our high sensitivity trigger makes sure to snap shut in micro-seconds eliminating the chance of a quick escape. Door also locks in place once down so can't be pushed open.
COLLAPSIBLE FOR EASY STORAGE: Unlinke other traps ours folds flat for easy storage without taking up too much room in your garage, shed, attic or other storage place.
VIDEO TO HELP WITH ASSEMBLY: In the instructions you'll receive there is a link to our video showing how to easily assemble the trap.
